OcelotInterface Package¶

OcelotInterface Package¶

OcelotInterface Module¶

Ocelot GUI, interface for running and testing accelerator optimization methods

This file primarily contains the code for the UI and GUI The scanner classes are contained in an external file, scannerThreads.py The resetpanel widget is also contained in a separate module, resetpanel

Tyler Cope, 2016

class OcelotInterface.OcelotInterface.ItemSample(item)[source]¶

Bases: pyqtgraph.graphicsItems.GraphicsWidget.GraphicsWidget

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QFrame

Main class for the GUI application

addList()¶
addPlots()[source]¶

Initializes the GUIs plots and labels on startup.

changeDRV()¶

Set boolian on whether the scan should use corrector DRVH and DRVL to set range.

This only applies to the simplex/scipy minimize methods, not the GP so far.

devmode()[source]¶

Used to setup a development mode for quick testing.

This method contains settings for a dev mode on GUI startup.

Uses the following PVs as dev devices:
SIOC:SYS0:ML00:CALCOUT997 SIOC:SYS0:ML00:CALCOUT998 SIOC:SYS0:ML00:CALCOUT999 SIOC:SYS0:ML00:CALCOUT000
Uses the following PV as an objective function:
SIOC:SYS0:ML00:CALCOUT993

Best used with the epics dev control panel fromt he GUIs options panel.

disableStuff()[source]¶

Method to disable development functionality durring production use.

emptyTable()¶

getPlotData()[source]¶

Collects data and updates plot on every GUI clock cycle.

launchHeatMap()[source]¶

Launches script to display a GP heatmap of two PVs selected from table.

Can only show data from the GUIs last scan.

loadStyleSheet()[source]¶

Sets the dark GUI theme from a css file.

Send a screenshot to the physics logbook.

Args:
extra_log_text (str): string to set if verbose text should be printed to logbook. ‘default’ prints only gain and algorithm

Method to start the scanner thread object.

runScript()[source]¶

Method to run a set of scripted commands throught the GUI.

This is used in development/MD for quickly scanning many sets in sequence.

saveData(data_new)[source]¶

Save scan data to the physics matlab data directory.

Uses module matlog to save data dict in machine interface file.

scanFinished()[source]¶

Reset the GUI after a scan is complete.

scanMethodSelect()[source]¶

Sets scanner method from options panel combo box selection.

This method executes from the runScan() method, when the UI “Start Scan” button is pressed.

Returns:
Selected scanner object These objects are contrained in the scannerThreads.py file
screenShot(filename, filetype)[source]¶

Takes a screenshot of the whole gui window, saves png and ps images to file

Args:
fileName (str): Directory string of where to save the file filetype (str): String of the filetype to save
scriptScan(index)[source]¶

Single scan to run in the script.

The sequency of events: * Select optimizer type based on index arg * Execute runScan() method * Start the wait() method until thread finishes * Send data to logbook (data file saved separatly automaticaly) * Reset all devices to start

Args:
index (int): Integer to choose algorithm method from combobox
selectQuads()¶
setDataDelay()[source]¶

Select time for objective method data collection time.

Scanner will wait this long to collect new data.

setDevice()¶

Method to select new Device to Scan, mnust be valid PV.

Set number of iterations to run the simplex scan before GP runs.

Method to select new objective function PV (GDET).

Typically the gas detector, but it could be some other calc PV.

setScale()¶

Set boolian on whether the scan should use Scale PV for Objective function PV.

This only applies to the simplex/scipy minimize methods, not the GP so far.

setScanParameters()[source]¶

Initialize default parameters for a scan when the GUI starts up.

Creates connection for parameter changes on options panel.

setTrim()¶

Set boolian on whether the scan should use trim PV for devices devices.

This only applies to the simplex/scipy minimize methods, not the GP so far.

setTrimDelay()[source]¶

Select a new trim time for a device from GUI line edit.

Scanner will wait this long before starting data acquisition.

setTrimPV()¶
setUpMultiPlot(pvs)[source]¶

Reset plots when a new scan is started.

useCall()¶

Set boolian on whether the scan should wait for change on objective funciton.

This only applies to the simplex/scipy minimize methods, not the GP so far.

wait()[source]¶

Method to wait for thread completion.

When running in script mode for development, this method waits until the scan thread has finished to launch the next test scan. Without this, the GUI try to start may threads at the same time instead of ordered,

class OcelotInterface.OcelotInterface.customLegend(size=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Bases: pyqtgraph.graphicsItems.LegendItem.LegendItem

STUFF FOR PG CUSTOM LEGEND (subclassed from pyqtgraph). Class responsible for drawing a single item in a LegendItem (sans label). This may be subclassed to draw custom graphics in a Legend.

addItem(item, name, color='CCFF00')[source]¶
OcelotInterface.OcelotInterface.main()[source]¶

Funciton to start up the main program.

Slecting a PV parameter set: If launched from the command line will take an argument with the filename of a parameter file. If no argv[1] is provided, the default list in ./parameters/lclsparams is used.

Development mode: If devmode == False - GUI defaults to normal parameter list, defaults to nelder mead simplex if devmode == True - GUI uses 4 development matlab PVs and loaded settings in the method “devmode()”

scannerThreads Module¶

File to contain scanner classes to be used in the ocelot interface GUI

Tyler Cope, 2016

class OcelotInterface.scannerThreads.GpInterfaceWrapper(pvs, delay, mi, dp)[source]¶

Class that acts as an interface to the GP code.

GP needed different getter and setter nameing conventions.

class OcelotInterface.scannerThreads.GpScanner(parent=None, seed_file='parameters/simSeed.mat', hyp_file='parameters/hyperparameters.npy', seedScanBool=False, seedIters=5, norm_amp_coeff=1.0)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Class to setup gaussian process bayes optimization scanner.

Similar style to the scipy/simplex ocelot scanner class. Uses the GP bayes optimization package writen by Mitch McIntire

calcAmpCoeffHP(ave, std, c=0.5)[source]¶

Method to calculate the GP amplitude hyperparameter

Formula for hyperparameters are from Mitch and some papers he read on the GP.

First we tried using the standard deviation to calc this but we found it needed to scale with mean instead

Args:
ave (float): Mean of of the objective function (GDET or something else) std (float): Standard deviation of the objective function c (float): Scaling factor to change the output to be larger or smaller, determined empirically
Returns:
Float of the calculated amplitude hyperparameter
calcLengthScaleHP(ave, std, c=1.0, pv=None)[source]¶

Method to calculate the GP length scale hyperparameters using history data

Formula for hyperparameters are from Mitch and some papers he read on the GP.

Args:
ave (float): Mean of the device, binned around current machine energy std (float): Standard deviation of the device c (float): Scaling factor to change the output to be larger or smaller, determined empirically pv (str): PV input string to scale hyps depending on pv, not currently used
Returns:
Float of the calculated length scale hyperparameter
calcNoiseHP(ave, std, c=1.0)[source]¶

Method to calculate the GP noise hyperparameter

Formula for hyperparameters are from Mitch and some papers he read on the GP.

Args:
ave (float): Mean of of the objective function (GDET or something else) std (float): Standard deviation of the objective function c (float): Scaling factor to change the output to be larger or smaller, determined empirically
Returns:
Float of the calculated noise hyperparameter
loadHyperParams(filename, gain=1)[source]¶

Method to load in the hyperparameters from a .npy file.

Sorts data, ordering parameters with this objects pv list. Formats data into tuple format that the GP model object can accept. ( [device_1, ..., device_N ], coefficent, noise)

Args:
filename (str): String for the file directory.
Returns:
List of hyperparameters, ordered using the UI’s “self.pvs” list.
loadModelParams(model, filename)[source]¶

Method to build the GP model using loaded model parameters

Can give this method an ocelot save file to load in that files model

Args:
filename (str): String for the file directory model (object): Takes in a GP model object
Returns:
GP model object with parameters from loaded data
loadSeedData(filename)[source]¶

Load in the seed data from a matlab ocelot scan file.

Input file should formated like OcelotInterface file format. ie. the datasets that are saved into the matlab data folder.

Pulls out the vectors of data from the save file. Sorts them into the same order as this scanner objects pv list. The GP wont work if the data is in the wrong order and loaded data is not ordered.

Args:
filename (str): String for the .mat file directory.
Returns:
Matrix of ordered data for GP. [ len(num_iterations) x len(num_devices) ]
run()[source]¶

Method to start up the GP scanner thread. This method behaves differently depending on if the user chooses to load data or live seed. If set to load in a matlab file or model from a matlab save file, the GP scanner executes immediatly. If set to run a seed optimization scan, it first executes the ‘runSeed()’ method, then the GP.

runSeed()[source]¶

Method to run if user has chose a to the live simplex seed scan mode.

1). Creates a new simplex/scipy OcelotScanner object. 2). Takes in the current mi and dp objects so that the saved data comes out in the same file 3). Runs the simplex/scipy for ‘self.seedIters’ number of iterations 4). Takes the data fromthe simplex/scipy scan and uses that to start the GP

There is some wierd logic here to make sure that the both scanners exit if user hits abort Not ideal and could get fixed later

Returns:
False: If the user choose to abort durring the seed optimize True: If the user did not abort
saveModel()[source]¶

Add GP model parameters to the save file.

setup(pvs, objective_func_pv, iters=45)[source]¶

Basic setup procedure for the GP scan objects, input args that are common to optimizer classes.

Similar setup funtion with the same args as the ocelot scanner. Does not contain option to load in MachineInterface and DeviceProperties

Could probably just write all this into the init function if you have motivation.

Args:
pvs (List[str]): List of the PVs to be used in scan objective_func_pv (str): String for the PV for the value to maximize iters (int): Number of iterations for the scanner to run
class OcelotInterface.scannerThreads.OcelotScanner(parent=None, method='simplex', norm_amp_coeff=1.0)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

This is a threaded class that runs the simplex and other scipy methods from ocelot.

Uses the lcls machine interface and device properties class to interface with epics.

loadNormFile(filename, amplitude_coeff=1.0)[source]¶
loadNormFile2(filename, amplitude_coeff=1.0)[source]¶

Load in precalculated normalization parameters from a file.

This file is generated using the ‘archiveRetrieve’ module. The file should be CSV formatted,ie:

PV1,mu1,sigma1 PV2,mu2,sigma2 ...

The amplitude coefficent input arg is used to quickly modify the aproximate strength of the scan. A larger coefficent will make the optimizer take lager steps (more exploration).

Args:
filename (str): String for the file directory amplitude_coeff (float): Scaling factor to modify device range
Returns:
inputNormParams (dict): Dict of normalization coefficents {‘keys’: [mu,sig]}
run(guimode=True)[source]¶

Method to start up the thread.

In this class, the squence length is only one, using all the PVs from the setup funciton. If guimode is selected, when the scan is finished the GUI update clock stops and data is saved to file.

Args:
guimode (bool): Bool that tells parent GUI to reset UI and save data. If running a GP seeded scan, dont reset GUI after simpelx is done
Returns:
The kill status (bool) of optimizer object if not in GUI mode This is used in the case that this object is used in seeded mode for the GP optimizer
setup(pvs, objective_func_pv, iters=45, mi=None, dp=None)[source]¶

Basic setup of the ocelot scanner.

The setup method is called from the GUI when a scan is started. This method should have the same arguments for each scanner.

Args:
pvs (List[str]): List of the PVs to be used in scan objective_func_pv (str): String for the PV for the value to maximize iters (int): Number of iterations for the scanner to run mi: MachineInterface object from the mint file dp: DeviceProperties oject fromt the mint file
